alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 18 at 12:09PM PDT until March 22 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SUNDAY TO 11 AM PDT MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet above 6000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 24 inches with the higher totals south of highway 88. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM Sunday to 11 AM PDT Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be 5000-5500 feet falling to 3500 to 4000 feet Monday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
